filmography.title: You Can't Take It With You
filmography.role_description: The son of a wealthy, uptight banker who falls in love with a woman from a delightfully eccentric and free-spirited family, forcing a clash of values.
filmography.plot: A man from a family of rich snobs becomes engaged to a woman from a good-natured but decidedly eccentric family.

filmography.title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
filmography.role_description: A naive and idealistic leader of the Boy Rangers who is appointed to the U.S. Senate and single-handedly fights against deep-seated political corruption.
filmography.plot: A naive man is appointed to fill a vacancy in the United States Senate. His plans promptly collide with political corruption, but he doesn't back down.

filmography.title: The Shop Around the Corner
filmography.role_description: A hardworking gift shop employee in Budapest who constantly bickers with a female co-worker, unaware that she is the anonymous pen pal he has fallen for.
filmography.plot: Two employees at a gift shop can barely stand each other, without realizing that they are falling in love through the post as each other's anonymous pen pal.

filmography.title: The Philadelphia Story
filmography.role_description: A cynical tabloid reporter who covers the wedding of a wealthy socialite but unexpectedly falls for her, challenging his own prejudices about the upper class.
filmography.plot: When a rich woman's ex-husband and a reporter turn up just before her planned remarriage, she begins to learn the truth about herself.

filmography.title: It's a Wonderful Life
filmography.role_description: A compassionate businessman who sacrifices his personal dreams for his community, only to be saved from suicide by an angel showing him the world without him.
filmography.plot: An angel is sent from Heaven to help a desperately frustrated businessman by showing him what life would have been like if he had never existed.

filmography.title: Rope
filmography.role_description: A shrewd and suspicious prep school housemaster who attends a dinner party hosted by two former students and slowly realizes they have committed a murder.
filmography.plot: Two men attempt to prove they committed the perfect crime by hosting a dinner party after strangling their former classmate to death.

filmography.title: Winchester '73
filmography.role_description: A hard-edged cowboy who relentlessly pursues an outlaw across the West to retrieve a prize-winning rifle and settle a personal vendetta.
filmography.plot: A cowboy's obsession with a prize-winning rifle leads him on a chase through the Wild West.

filmography.title: Harvey
filmography.role_description: A gentle, eccentric, and constantly tipsy man whose best friend is a six-foot, three-and-a-half-inch tall invisible rabbit named Harvey.
filmography.plot: Due to his insistence that he has an invisible six-foot-tall rabbit for a best friend, a whimsical middle-aged man is thought by his family to be insane.

filmography.title: Rear Window
filmography.role_description: A professional photographer confined to a wheelchair with a broken leg who passes the time by spying on his neighbors and becomes convinced one has committed murder.
filmography.plot: A wheelchair-bound photographer spies on his neighbors from his Greenwich Village courtyard apartment window, and becomes convinced one of them has committed murder.

filmography.title: The Man Who Knew Too Much
filmography.role_description: An American physician vacationing in Morocco who, along with his wife, is drawn into an assassination plot when their son is kidnapped to ensure their silence.
filmography.plot: A family vacationing in Morocco accidentally stumbles on to an assassination plot and the conspirators look determined to prevent them from interfering.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Nominee – Palme d'Or

filmography.title: Vertigo
filmography.role_description: A former police detective with a paralyzing fear of heights who becomes obsessively infatuated with the mysterious woman he has been hired to follow.
filmography.plot: A former police detective juggles wrestling with his personal demons and becoming obsessed with a hauntingly beautiful woman.
filmography.awards: Sight & Sound: Voted #1 Greatest Film of All Time (2012)

filmography.title: Anatomy of a Murder
filmography.role_description: A brilliant but humble small-town lawyer who battles a slick big-city prosecutor while defending an Army lieutenant in a complex and salacious murder trial.
filmography.plot: An upstate Michigan lawyer defends a soldier who claims he killed an innkeeper due to 'irresistible impulse' after the man raped his wife.

filmography.title: The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance
filmography.role_description: An idealistic young attorney from the East who travels West to bring law and order, but gains fame for a violent act he may not have committed.
filmography.plot: A senator returns to a western town for the funeral of an old friend and tells the story of his origins.
